intro: Aruba cuspidata, commonly known as the Aruban thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the island of Aruba. It belongs to the family Solanaceae, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its distinctive spiny calyx. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by orange to red berries. It thrives in arid and coastal environments, often found growing in sandy soils. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is a notable species in the flora of the Leeward Islands.
